intro: Ampelopsis neilgherrensis, commonly known as the Himalayan grapevine, is a climbing vine native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the Vitaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by berries, which turn red when mature. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in forested areas at higher elevations. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture.
